intro: Buchnera tenuissima, commonly known as the slender bugseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Buchnera tenuissima thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
